function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Dissemination of unverified medical information and false news on social media can contribute to panic and misinformation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social media platforms can be used to incite panic and spread false information about the pandemic, contributing to public distrust and confusion.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mismanagement of crisis communication on social media can lead to ineffective dissemination of accurate information and exacerbate public fear and confusion.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-compliance with covid-19 measures","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Normalization of non-compliance with covid-19 measures","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate trust in science and media reporting","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of sustained compliance with public health measures","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Easing of restrictions leading to increased social gatherings","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Erosion of moral support for compliance over time","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Noncompliance with stay at home and social distancing measures","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intrinsic motivations influencing compliance","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limitations of self-reported compliance data","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shifting political divide in addressing the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid changes in people’s behavior and attitudes","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in the impact of political views on compliance","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Resistance to authority and measures","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Political orientation not a predictor of compliance","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of compliance with social distancing measures","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unemployment leading to economic and social consequences","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Backlash against authorities leading to resistance to compliance","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of social norm on compliance behavior","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequality in compliance due to practical limitations","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential decline in compliant behavior over time","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Short-term compliance due to low impact of costs and negative emotions","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Individual differences in compliance based on impulsiveness","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in achieving minimum certainty of punishment for violating covid-19 measures","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mixed results in the relationship between moral support for measures and compliant behavior","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perception of personal costs not influencing compliance","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative emotions increasing compliance with stay-at-home measures","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relatively high self-reported compliance with covid-19 mitigation measures","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Large reductions in retail and recreational activities, as well as in the usage of public transit, and visits to workplaces","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"People meeting with friends and relatives outside of their direct household","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clarity in covid-19 measures","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-normative obligation to obey the law","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Political orientation not associated with compliance","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close contact with multiple individuals during data collection or analysis may increase the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Conducting in-person surveys or interviews for data collection may pose a risk of exposure to contagious diseases for both data collectors and participants.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sharing and handling physical documents or materials during the research process may create opportunities for the transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Measurement error in survey questions or responses","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential bias in survey responses","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Participants may have low compliance with covid-19 mitigation measures, increasing the risk of disease spread.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Perceived clarity of covid-19 measures may be low, leading to confusion and potential non-adherence to the guidelines.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Participants may have opportunities to violate covid-19 mitigation measures, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor correlation of one item in relation to the others may affect the overall accuracy of the findings.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of an item due to low cronbach’s alpha may result in a loss of valuable insights or aspects of the phenomenon under study.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Measurement of negative impact and emotions related to covid-19 measures may lead to psychological distress for participants.","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of 25 participants providing professional care for covid-19 patients increases the risk of bias in the final sample.","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of 7 participants who failed the attention check may lead to a biased final sample.","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Collection of personal data such as age, gender, education, and health status increases the risk of privacy breaches.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential influence of political orientation on compliance with pandemic measures","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"}]}
